dcsControllerServer.dcsControllerServer module¶

This module provides a class for an OPCUA server for the DCS Controller.

It also provides a function for using this server as a command line tool.

@author: Sebastian Scholz

class dcsControllerServer.dcsControllerServer.DCSControllerServer(edsfile=None, loglevel=None, channel=None, logformat='%(asctime)s %(levelname)-8s %(message)s', endpoint=None, bitrate=-4, xmlfile=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

OPC UA server for DCS Controllers in a CAN network.

Establishes communication with DCS Controllers on a CAN bus and create corresponding OPC UA objects. The CAN communication is started during initialization but the OPC UA server has to be started separatly.

Example

For trying this just execute this file:

$ python DCSControllerServer.py

It recommended that this class is initialized within a with statement to make use of the __enter__ and __exit__ methods so that all open connections get cleaned up in case of errors.

__init__(edsfile=None, loglevel=None, channel=None, logformat='%(asctime)s %(levelname)-8s %(message)s', endpoint=None, bitrate=-4, xmlfile=None)[source]¶

Initialize OPC UA Server and CANopen communication.

The Initialization does several things in the following order:
  • Initialize logging
  • Configure OPC UA server
  • Import OPC UA Objects Types from XML
  • Configure and open CAN channel
  • Import Object Dictionary from EDS
Parameters:
  • edsfile (str) – File path of EDS. The default will search for ‘CANControllerForPSPPv1.eds’ in the directory of this file.
  • loglevel (int) – Defines which log messages are displayed.
  • channel (int) – Number of the Kvaser CAN channel to be used.
  • logformat (str) – Defines formatting of log messages. Defaults to a compact form containing only time, levelname and message.
  • endpoint (str) – Endpoint of the OPC UA server. Defaults to ‘opc.tcp://localhost:4840/’
  • bitrate (int) – CAN bitrate to be used. The default value correponds to a frequency of 125 kHz.
  • xmlfile (str) – File name or path of OPC UA model design file. The default searches ‘dcscontrollerdesign.xml’ in the directory of this file.
bitRate¶

int – Currently used bit rate. When you try to change it stop will be called before.

channel¶

int – Currently used CAN channel. When you try to change it stop will be called before.

create_mirrored_objects()[source]¶

Create mirror Classes for every UA object.

This method sets the CANopen node id to the Controller UA objects and creates mirror classes that mirror the whole UA address space. Note that the dictionary where these classes are stored is emptied at the start of this methods.

Warning

This method must be called after the server is started and after the UA objects have been created.

dumpMessage(cobid, msg, dlc, flag, time)[source]¶

Dumps a CANopen message to the screen and log file

Parameters:
  • cobid (int) – CAN identifier
  • msg (bytes) – CAN data - max length 8
  • dlc (int) – Data Length Code
  • flag (int) – Flags, a combination of the canMSG_xxx and canMSGERR_xxx values
  • time (float) – Timestamp from hardware
endpoint¶

str – Port where the server is listening to

idx¶

int – Index of custom namespace

isinit¶

bool – If all initialization routines have been executed

myDCs¶

list – List of created UA objects

mypyDCs¶

dict – Dictionary containing DCS Controller mirror classes. Key is the CANopen node id.

od¶

Object dictionary for checking access attributes

rdm_set_conn_PSPP()[source]¶

Wrapper function which randomly sets connected PSPPs

run(timeout=50)[source]¶

Start actual CANopen communication

Parameters:timeout – SDO timeout in milliseconds (Defaults to 50 ms.)
scan_nodes(timeout=50)[source]¶

Do a complete scan over all CAN nodes

The internally stored information about all nodes are reset. This method will be called by the __init__ method. It should also be used to reestablish communication when it was lost or when a new device was connected while the user program is running.

This works by reading a mandatory OD object with SDO of all nodes and removing those which do not respond.

This overrides any previous configurations and empties the lists and dictionaries for stored objects.

Parameters:timeout (int) – SDO timeout in milliseconds
sdo_read(nodeId, index, subindex, timeout=50)[source]¶

Read an object via SDO

Currently expedited and segmented transfer is supported by this method. The user has to decide how to decode the data.

Parameters:
  • nodeId (int) – The id from the node to read from
  • index (int) – The od index to read from
  • subindex (int) – Subindex. Defaults to zero for single value entries
  • timeout (int) – SDO timeout in milliseconds
Returns:

The data if was successfully read * None: In case of errors
Return type:

  • list(int)
sdo_write(nodeId, index, subindex, value, timeout=50)[source]¶

Write an object via SDO expedited write protocol

This sends the request and analyses the response.

Parameters:
  • nodeId (int) – The id from the node to read from
  • index (int) – The od index to read from
  • subindex (int) – Subindex. Defaults to zero for single value entries
  • value (int) – The value you want to write.
  • timeout (int) – SDO timeout in milliseconds
Returns:

If writing the object was successful
Return type:

bool
server = None¶

opcua.Server – Handles the OPC UA server.

set_connected_PSPP(nodeId=42, data=None, timeout=50, userdmvals=None)[source]¶

Set which PSPPs are connected to a specified Controller

Parameters:
  • nodeId (int) – Node Id of the Controller. Defaults to None.
  • data (list(int)) – 4*16 bit of information about connected PSPPs. Defaults to None.
  • timeout (int) – SDO timeout in milliseconds
  • userdmvals (bool) – Generate random connections if True. Defaults to None.
start()[source]¶

Start the server and open the CAN connection

Make sure that this is called so that the connection is established.

Steps:
  • Open CAN channel
  • Scan CAN bus for nodes (and create UA objects)
  • Start the actual OPCUA server
  • Create python objects mirroring the UA address space
  • Start the main run() routine

This method has a small error tolerance and restarts 2 two times in case of errors.

stop()[source]¶

Close CAN channel and stop the OPC UA server

Make sure that this is called so that the connection is closed in a correct manner. When this class is used within a with statement this method is called automatically when the statement is exited.

dcsControllerServer.dcsControllerServer.main()[source]¶

Wrapper function for using the server as a command line tool

The command line tool accepts arguments for configuring the server which are tranferred to the DCSControllerServer class.
